action.action-desc: Mr. Loudermilk (for himself, Mr. Gottheimer, and Mr. Duffy) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act of 1996 to ensure that Federal financial regulators perform a comprehensive review of regulations to identify outdated or otherwise unnecessary regulatory requirements imposed on covered persons, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Comprehensive Regulatory Review Act.

section.header: Amendments to definitions of the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act
section.text: Section 2001(c) of the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act of 1996 (12 U.S.C. 252 note) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:

paragraph.text: The term covered person has the meaning given such term in section 1002 of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5481).

The term Federal financial regulator means the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and the National Credit Union Administration Board.

subsection.text: Subsection (a) of section 2222 of the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act of 1996 (12 U.S.C. 3311(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 10 years and inserting 7 years;
by striking each appropriate and all that follows through review and inserting the Federal financial regulators shall each conduct a comprehensive review;
by striking such appropriate Federal banking agency and inserting such Federal financial regulator, jointly or otherwise,; and
by inserting or covered persons after insured depository institutions.
in subsections (b), (c), (d), and (e), by striking the appropriate Federal banking agency each place that term appears and inserting the appropriate Federal financial regulator; and
in subsection (e)(1), by striking the appropriate Federal banking agencies and inserting the appropriate Federal financial regulator.

section.text: Section 2222 of the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act of 1996 (12 U.S.C. 3311), as amended by section 3, is further amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking 10 years and inserting 7 years; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking and at the end;
in paragraph (2), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: tailor other regulations related to covered persons in a manner that limits the regulatory compliance impact, cost, liability risk, and other burdens, unless otherwise determined by the Council or the appropriate Federal financial regulator.

section.text: Section 2222 of the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act of 1996 (12 U.S.C. 3311), as amended by section 4, is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: The Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection shall—

paragraph.text: use any relevant information from an assessment conducted under section 1022(d) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5512(d)) in conducting the review required under subsection (a); and
conduct such review in accordance with the purposes and objectives described in subsections (a) and (b) of section 1021 of such Act (12 U.S.C. 5511).
